review_title: Extreme mix of both high and low income students. Economy is oil boom driven.
pros: The city is large enough to sustain all of your needs, especially if you are from a more urban or metropolitan area. The school district is definitely focused on students and their positive development. The schools are average for the most part, with several that really stand out as exemplary.
cons: Not much support or funding for additional training or professional development. I never felt comfortable approaching my principal to ask for a day off. She was later fired after being at the school for 17 or so years. There is an extremely high turnover rate there for teachers because of the oil industry. One can make fifty or so dollars an hour working on an oil rig vs. teaching undisciplined kids.

review_title: Hope you like a weed eater
pros: Full benefits!  Off at 4 regular season off at 3 during summer. Special projects are always fun which come around usually 2-3 times per week. Friendly people. Its really not a bad place to work if you don't mind being poor. Kinda like a tool from Harbor Freight, you get what you pay for.
cons: Pick up trash evvvery morning, management needs a facelift as well as the landscaping and irrigation. Dont expect to show up as a new hire and lead by example no one will over exert theirselves for anything. But they are friendly.

review_title: The job at UTPB was a promotion for me and I had good opportunity for personal development while employed there.
pros:
Awesome, motivated student body, many who are first generation minority college students.
Community support for and participation in university programs.
cons:
UTPB has faced some tough budgetary issues over the past 5 years.
As with many higher education organizations, a lot of political in-fighting.
Cost of living is very high in the Odessa/Midland area.

pros: The scheduling is very flexible, and the responsibilities align with the program's (and my) educational goals. The salary is augmented by a tuition remission.
cons: The office is shared with two Math adjuncts.

job_title: Former Staff Manager in Odessa, TX
pros: City is very easy to get around. Mild winters.
cons: No room for advancement if you're a staff member.  All middle management openings go to faculty.  Very low pay.  University awards more scholarships than they should.  Therefore, there is no money left for raises or job creation.  Only a few people on campus are paid well and the rest are very poorly paid.

pros: The flexibility was great. Put in your 20 hours when it works for you. I also enjoyed having a weekly meeting with the professor I was helping, who really took interest in my work.
cons: Pay is low, otherwise a great experience.
